Title:
Rediscovery of Dacrymyces pezizoides Kobayasi (Dacrymycetes,
Basidiomycota) after 80 years from its original description
Keywords:
Dacrymycetaceae, Dacrymycetales, Japan, Molecular
phylogeny, Taxonomy
Abstract:
Dacrymyces pezizoides was rediscovered for the first time
since its original description in 1939. Dacrymycetous fruiting bodies
were collected from dead branches of broad-leaved trees in Japan and
identified as D. pezizoides based on morphological characteristics such
as turbinate or discoid basidiocarps, hyphae without clamp connections,
thick-walled marginal hyphae, and 3-septate basidiospores. Molecular
phylogenetic analysis based on LSU rDNA and ITS regions showed that D.
pezizoides made a monophyletic group with Dacrymyces spp. such as D.
stillatus and D. chrysospermus, and Guepiniopsis buccina. Dacrymyces
pezizoides is considered to form their basidiocarps in Autumn on dead
wood of broad-leaved trees in warm-temperate areas of Japan.
